{"step_by_step_thinking": "The newborn in this case has multiple characteristic features, including micrognathia, broad nasal bridge, short philtrum, small low-set ears, cleft palate, and a grade 3/6 systolic ejection murmur. These findings are consistent with the diagnosis of DiGeorge syndrome, also known as 22q11.2 deletion syndrome. This syndrome is caused by a deletion on chromosome 22q11.2. Therefore, the most likely finding on further evaluation would be a chromosome 22q11.2 deletion on FISH studies.", "answer_choice": "C"}
